about.name: Munich
about.info_text: Munich, the capital of Bavaria, is a charming and historic city in southern Germany. Known for its rich culture, beer gardens, and picturesque architecture, Munich offers a delightful blend of tradition and modernity. Visitors can explore historic sites, indulge in Bavarian cuisine, and enjoy the city's vibrant arts and music scene. Whether you're strolling through the English Garden or sipping beer at the famous Hofbräuhaus, Munich has something to offer every traveler.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.5 million
State: Bavaria (Bayern)
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: German
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Munich experiences a continental climate with cold winters and warm summers. The city is known for its beautiful parks and gardens, which are ideal for enjoying the outdoors in the summer months.

attractions_card.title: Marienplatz
attractions_card.description: Marienplatz is Munich's central square and home to the famous Glockenspiel, a musical clock with dancing figurines. It's a bustling hub of activity and a great starting point for exploring the city.

attractions_card.title: Nymphenburg Palace
attractions_card.description: Nymphenburg Palace is a magnificent Baroque palace complex surrounded by lush gardens. Visitors can explore the opulent rooms and enjoy the beautiful park grounds.

attractions_card.title: English Garden
attractions_card.description: The English Garden is one of the world's largest urban parks, offering green spaces, serene lakes, and even a Chinese pagoda. It's a great place for leisurely walks and picnics.

attractions_card.title: Hofbräuhaus
attractions_card.description: Hofbräuhaus is an iconic Munich beer hall where you can savor traditional Bavarian beer, hearty food, and live music in a lively and historic atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: Viktualienmarkt
attractions_card.description: Viktualienmarkt is a bustling food market in the heart of Munich. You can find fresh produce, local delicacies, and enjoy outdoor beer gardens.

attractions_card.title: Olympiapark
attractions_card.description: The Olympiapark is a vast sports and leisure complex, famous for its futuristic architecture. You can enjoy panoramic views from the Olympic Tower or catch a concert or event at the Olympic Stadium.

attractions_card.title: Deutsches Museum
attractions_card.description: The Deutsches Museum is one of the world's largest science and technology museums, featuring a wide range of interactive exhibits and collections.

attractions_card.title: BMW Welt
attractions_card.description: BMW Welt is a unique experience for car enthusiasts, offering a glimpse into the world of BMW with exhibitions of their latest vehicles and technologies.

food_card.title: Weisswurst
food_card.description: Weisswurst is a traditional Bavarian sausage made from minced veal and pork back bacon. It's typically flavored with parsley, lemon, mace, onions, ginger, and cardamom.

food_card.title: Pretzels
food_card.description: Soft pretzels, known as Brezn in Bavarian, are a beloved snack in Munich. They are often enjoyed with mustard and make a perfect pairing with beer.

food_card.title: Sauerbraten
food_card.description: Sauerbraten is a pot roast, typically of beef (but sometimes pork, lamb, mutton, or traditionally, horse), marinated before slow-cooking in a mixture of vinegar or wine and water.

food_card.title: Apfelstrudel
food_card.description: Apfelstrudel, or apple strudel, is a classic German pastry filled with spiced apples, cinnamon, and raisins, often served with a dollop of whipped cream.

food_card.title: Beer
food_card.description: Munich is famous for its beer, and you can enjoy a wide variety of brews. The city hosts the annual Oktoberfest, the world's largest beer festival.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Vier Jahreszeiten Kempinski Munich
hotels_card.description: This luxury hotel in the heart of Munich offers elegant rooms, gourmet dining, and a spa. It's known for its impeccable service and central location.

hotels_card.title: Bayerischer Hof
hotels_card.description: Bayerischer Hof is a renowned five-star hotel in Munich, offering a variety of restaurants, a rooftop bar, and a cinema. It's a blend of tradition and modern comfort.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Königshof
hotels_card.description: Hotel Königshof is a luxury boutique hotel near Marienplatz, known for its elegant design, personalized service, and gourmet dining.

hotels_card.title: Mandarin Oriental, Munich
hotels_card.description: Mandarin Oriental, Munich is a five-star hotel with a prime location near Maximilianstrasse. It offers elegant rooms, a rooftop bar, and a spa.

hotels_card.title: Leonardo Hotel Munich Arabellapark
hotels_card.description: This modern hotel in the Bogenhausen district offers comfortable accommodations, a restaurant, and easy access to public transport.

transport_card.title: Munich S-Bahn
transport_card.description: The Munich S-Bahn is an efficient urban rail network connecting the city and its suburbs. It's a convenient way to travel around Munich and the surrounding areas.

transport_card.title: Trams and Buses
transport_card.description: Munich has an extensive tram and bus network that covers the entire city, making it easy to reach various neighborhoods and attractions.

transport_card.title: U-Bahn (Metro)
transport_card.description: The Munich U-Bahn, or metro, is another efficient mode of public transportation that complements the S-Bahn and connects the city's key areas.

transport_card.title: Munich Airport (MUC)
transport_card.description: Munich Airport, also known as Franz Josef Strauss International Airport, is the primary international gateway to Munich and the surrounding region.
